abstract.text: Creates a graphics context to draw the thumbnail in.

inlineContent.text: Use a QLThumbnailReply in a Thumbnail Extension to provide thumbnails for your file types.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

platforms.message: Use a QLThumbnailReply in a Thumbnail Extension to provide thumbnails for your file types.
platforms.name: macOS

inlineContent.text: The size of the thumbnail; if
is
the size is in pixels, otherwise itâ€™s in points.
if the thumbnail data is bitmap-based,
if vector-based. This value of this parameter affects the interpretation of the
parameter.
A dictionary containing properties for the thumbnail response. For macOS 10.5, no properties have been defined.
A Core Graphics graphics-context object that you can draw your thumbnail image in. You should explicitly release this object when it is no longer needed.
You can directly draw your thumbnail data in the graphics-context object created by this function. After calling this function, you should flush the context with
. Also be sure to release the
object.
With this function you can create two types of graphics contexts for drawing thumbnails: bitmap and single-page vector-based; you use the

flag to distinguish between the two. Quick Look handles bitmap thumbnail context differently than non-bitmap contexts; in the latter case, Quick Look might scale the drawing up or down if necessary, and it respects the scale factor (for HiDPI support).
If you prefer to work in Objective-C code, you can convert the created
to a
object using
Thread-safety: This function should be called in the same thread as the thumbnail request is made in; generally, this is the same thread in which the
callback was invoked.

abstract.text: An object that represents a graphics context.
Creates a new graphics context from the specified graphics port.
A Quartz 2D drawing environment.
Create previews of files to use inside your app, or perform simple edits on previews.
An opaque reference that represents a thumbnail request object.
Returns the UTI for the thumbnail request.
Returns the options specified for the thumbnail request.
Returns the URL of the document for which the thumbnail request is requested.
Creates a graphics context to draw the thumbnail in.
Flush the graphics context and sets the thumbnail response.
Returns the object thatâ€™s stored as part of a thumbnail request.
Get the bundle of the generator receiving the thumbnail request.
Returns the maximum size (in points) specified for the thumbnail image.
Gets the type identifier for the
opaque type.
Returns whether the thumbnail request has been cancelled by the client.
Stores an object as part of a thumbnail request.
Sets the thumbnail request to a specified image.
Sets the thumbnail request to contain the image at a given URL.
Sets the response to the thumbnail request to image data saved within the document.
Sets the default image representation for an item with the provided data and specified file type.
Sets the default image representation for an item of a given type at the specified URL.
A structure that contains width and height values.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A Quartz 2D drawing environment.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
